OpenMetrics enables consistent ingestion, processing, and export of telemetry data across systems.

name: k6 Operator
description: k6 Operator enables Kubernetes-native load testing by managing k6 tests as custom resources. It integrates k6 with the Kubernetes ecosystem, making it possible to schedule, manage, and scale load tests alongside application deployments. Ideal for performance regression testing in CI/CD pipelines using native Kubernetes workflows.

name: Skopeo
description: Skopeo is a command-line utility that performs operations on container images and registries. It can inspect remote images, copy between registries, and verify image signatures without requiring a local Docker daemon. Skopeo is widely used in CI/CD workflows and secure image scanning pipelines.

name: Kaniko
description: Kaniko is a tool to build container images from a Dockerfile inside a container or Kubernetes cluster. Unlike Docker, it doesn't require privileged access or a running daemon, making it suitable for CI/CD pipelines and restricted environments. It supports caching and pushing images to remote registries directly from cloud-native builds.

name: BuildKit
description: BuildKit is a modern build subsystem for Docker that improves performance, storage management, and parallelism in container builds. It supports cache import/export, remote cache backends, and advanced frontend support. BuildKit can be used standalone or integrated into Docker, and is the foundation of Docker Buildx.

name: Dive
description: Dive is a Docker image inspection tool that helps developers explore each layer of an image and discover inefficiencies. It provides insights into how space is used and what files are modified between layers, helping reduce image size and optimize build performance. Dive is often used in CI to validate image quality before deployment.

name: Crane
description: Crane is a container registry utility from Google that helps interact with container images in registries. It supports copying, modifying, and inspecting images without needing a local daemon. Crane is written in Go and designed for automation scripts, image rebasing, and lightweight DevOps pipelines.

name: Conftest
description: Conftest is a configuration testing tool that uses Open Policy Agent (OPA) and the Rego language to write unit tests for structured configuration files such as YAML, JSON, and TOML. It enables policy-as-code practices for validating Kubernetes manifests, Terraform plans, Dockerfiles, and more. Conftest integrates well into CI/CD pipelines and DevSecOps workflows.

name: tfsec
description: tfsec is a static analysis security scanner for Terraform code. It detects potential vulnerabilities and misconfigurations in Terraform files by applying rule-based logic to cloud provider best practices. tfsec supports custom rules, CI integration, and GitHub Actions, making it a widely used tool in infrastructure security pipelines.

name: Checkov
description: Checkov is a static code analysis tool for infrastructure-as-code (IaC) that detects security and compliance misconfigurations. It supports Terraform, CloudFormation, Kubernetes, and ARM templates. Checkov integrates with CI/CD systems and allows enforcing custom or built-in policies to ensure infrastructure security.

name: KICS
description: KICS (Keeping Infrastructure as Code Secure) is an open-source tool for scanning IaC files for security vulnerabilities, compliance issues, and misconfigurations. It supports formats like Terraform, Kubernetes, Docker, and Ansible. KICS comes with hundreds of built-in queries and integrates into CI tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, and GitHub Actions.

name: CloudQuery
description: CloudQuery is an open-source cloud asset inventory tool that extracts infrastructure metadata from cloud providers and stores it in a queryable database such as PostgreSQL or SQLite. It supports AWS, Azure, GCP, and more. CloudQuery is useful for auditing, compliance, and building custom dashboards or reports based on cloud configurations.

name: Steampipe
description: Steampipe is a tool that enables querying cloud infrastructure with SQL. It exposes cloud APIs as virtual tables and allows writing queries across services and accounts. Developers use Steampipe for auditing, security checks, and dashboards. It supports AWS, Azure, GCP, GitHub, Docker, and many more plugins.

name: Trivy
description: Trivy is a comprehensive security scanner for containers, file systems, and code repositories. It detects vulnerabilities in OS packages, language dependencies, IaC files, and container images. Trivy supports GitHub Actions, CI tools, and Kubernetes admission controllers, making it a central tool in DevSecOps workflows.

name: Dockle
description: Dockle is a container image linter that checks for best practices and security hardening. It verifies Dockerfile configurations for issues like root users, unverified packages, and exposed secrets. Dockle is useful for enforcing secure container development guidelines in CI/CD pipelines.

name: Grype
description: Grype is a vulnerability scanner for container images and filesystems. Developed by Anchore, it supports SBOM (Software Bill of Materials) generation and scanning against CVE databases. Grype can be used as a CLI tool or integrated into DevSecOps workflows for early vulnerability detection.

name: Syft
description: Syft is a CLI tool and Go library for generating SBOMs (Software Bill of Materials) from container images and file systems. It supports various output formats like JSON, SPDX, and CycloneDX. Syft is commonly paired with Grype for a complete SBOM + vulnerability scanning workflow in security-focused pipelines.

name: Semgrep
description: Semgrep is a fast, lightweight static analysis tool for finding bugs and enforcing code standards. It supports custom rule creation and pattern matching in multiple languages including Python, JavaScript, Go, and more. Semgrep is ideal for integrating security and code quality checks into CI pipelines with minimal setup.

name: Bandit
description: Bandit is a security linter for Python code that identifies common vulnerabilities such as injection risks, insecure file operations, and unsafe module usage. It's often used in CI pipelines to ensure secure Python development practices and compliance with OWASP guidelines.

name: Gosec
description: Gosec is a security analyzer for Golang code that inspects source files and packages for common security issues. It identifies problems like SQL injection, hardcoded credentials, and weak cryptography. Gosec is lightweight and easy to integrate into Go CI pipelines for DevSecOps workflows.

name: sqlmap
description: sqlmap is an open-source penetration testing tool that automates the detection and exploitation of SQL injection vulnerabilities. It supports a wide range of databases and injection techniques and includes features for database fingerprinting, data extraction, and file system access. Used by ethical hackers and security professionals worldwide.

name: Nikto
description: Nikto is an open-source web server scanner that performs comprehensive tests for vulnerabilities, outdated server software, and insecure configurations. It checks for over 6700 potentially dangerous files or scripts and is often used for reconnaissance in penetration testing and security audits.

name: WPScan
description: WPScan is a black-box WordPress vulnerability scanner that checks for security issues in core, plugins, and themes. It includes a public vulnerability database, brute-force login testing, and XML-RPC detection. WPScan is used by security teams and WordPress developers to audit and harden WordPress installations.

name: Nuclei
description: Nuclei is a fast, customizable vulnerability scanner based on templates. It allows developers and security researchers to create and run their own scanning templates for identifying misconfigurations, CVEs, and exposures. Widely used in bug bounty programs, it’s known for its speed and flexibility.

name: Amass
description: Amass is a tool for performing DNS enumeration, attack surface mapping, and external asset discovery. It supports passive, active, and brute-force modes and can output data in various formats. Amass is widely used in reconnaissance for bug bounty, red teaming, and penetration testing engagements.

name: Subfinder
description: Subfinder is a subdomain discovery tool that uses passive online sources to find valid subdomains for domain names. It is fast, written in Go, and used in security automation pipelines for reconnaissance. Subfinder integrates well with other tools like Amass, Nuclei, and httpx for deeper scanning.

name: httpx
description: httpx is a fast and multi-purpose HTTP toolkit built in Go that allows probing of web servers. It supports a wide range of features like TLS grabbing, HTTP methods probing, virtual host discovery, and custom headers. Often used in combination with subdomain scanners for asset discovery and reconnaissance.

name: Metabase
description: Metabase is an open-source business intelligence and data visualization tool that makes analytics accessible to everyone. It allows users to create dashboards, generate SQL and no-code queries, and embed visual reports. Metabase supports multiple databases like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, and Google BigQuery, and is popular for self-service analytics across startups and enterprises.

name: Redash
description: Redash is a lightweight data querying and dashboarding tool for teams. It connects to popular data sources and allows users to write SQL queries, visualize results, and share dashboards securely. Redash supports alerts, user permissions, and integrations with PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Athena, and others.

name: Apache Superset
description: Apache Superset is a modern data exploration and visualization platform that supports rich interactive dashboards, SQL IDE, chart-building UI, and RBAC. It integrates with a wide variety of SQL-speaking databases and supports caching and metadata layers for speed. Used by data teams in enterprise analytics and reporting workflows.

name: Grafana
description: Grafana is a multi-platform analytics and visualization platform that enables querying, visualization, and alerting for time series data. It integrates with Prometheus, Loki, Elasticsearch, InfluxDB, and many other data sources. Grafana is widely used for observability, monitoring, and building interactive real-time dashboards.

name: Kepler
description: Kepler is a real-time Kubernetes energy monitoring and analytics tool. It tracks energy consumption metrics using eBPF and performance counters to provide insights on power usage across workloads. Designed for sustainable cloud operations, it integrates with Prometheus and Grafana for visualization and alerting.

name: TimescaleDB
description: TimescaleDB is a PostgreSQL extension designed for time-series data. It offers high performance, compression, and advanced analytics for event-driven workloads such as IoT, monitoring, and financial data. TimescaleDB supports full SQL, continuous aggregates, and native Prometheus integration.

name: QuestDB GUI
description: QuestDB includes a built-in web-based SQL console for visualizing and querying time-series data. It provides syntax highlighting, auto-completion, and graph rendering for query results. The lightweight UI makes it easy to explore IoT, monitoring, and event data without complex setup.

name: ClickHouse GUI
description: ClickHouse provides several GUI clients and third-party integrations like Tabix, Altinity UI, and DBeaver for querying large-scale OLAP data. These tools allow building dashboards, exploring schema, and executing high-performance SQL queries across billions of rows. Suited for analytics, BI, and developer workflows.

name: Lightdash
description: Lightdash is a modern BI and analytics platform built on top of dbt and modern data stacks. It enables teams to define metrics in code, explore data visually, and share dashboards. It integrates with data warehouses like Snowflake, BigQuery, and Redshift and supports Git-based workflows for version control.

name: Looker SDK
description: Looker SDK provides programmatic access to Looker’s business intelligence platform. It allows integration of visualizations, dashboards, and data queries into applications. With support for multiple languages including Python, JavaScript, and TypeScript, Looker SDK helps developers embed insights and build data-powered experiences.

name: Retool
description: Retool is a low-code platform that enables developers to quickly build custom internal tools using drag-and-drop components and SQL/JS logic. It connects to databases, APIs, and cloud services, allowing teams to create dashboards, CRUD apps, and admin panels with minimal boilerplate. Used widely in operations, support, and internal analytics workflows.

name: Budibase
description: Budibase is an open-source platform for building internal business applications fast. It provides a visual builder, auto-generated CRUD interfaces, and support for PostgreSQL, MySQL, REST, and Airtable. Budibase apps can be deployed to the cloud or self-hosted, making it ideal for creating custom dashboards and workflows.

name: Plane
description: Plane is an open-source project and product management platform built for engineering teams. It offers task management, sprints, roadmaps, and team collaboration features similar to Jira, but with a developer-focused, self-hosted approach. Plane supports markdown, kanban boards, issue tracking, and integrations with GitHub and GitLab.

name: ToolJet
description: ToolJet is an open-source low-code platform for building internal tools. It offers drag-and-drop components, workflows, and data binding with support for databases, APIs, and third-party services. ToolJet enables rapid development of admin panels, dashboards, and custom interfaces and includes granular role-based access control (RBAC).

name: ILLA Cloud
description: ILLA Cloud is a low-code platform for building and deploying internal apps with support for REST, GraphQL, PostgreSQL, and more. It offers collaborative building, component libraries, AI agents, and integrations. ILLA enables non-developers to create production-ready tools while offering extensibility for engineers.

name: Basejump
description: Basejump is a developer-focused backend-as-a-service (BaaS) platform offering authentication, database, and API management in a lightweight and privacy-friendly way. It enables developers to build fast full-stack apps with minimal backend setup. Basejump supports PostgreSQL, SQLite, and RESTful API exposure.

name: Hoppscotch Server
description: Hoppscotch Server is the backend API layer for Hoppscotch, the popular open-source API development platform. It provides real-time collaboration, authentication, session management, and history sync across clients. Ideal for self-hosted API testing environments where privacy and offline access are important.

name: Directus
description: Directus is an open-source headless CMS and data platform that wraps any SQL database with a dynamic API and no-code admin interface. It supports role-based access control, versioning, workflows, and real-time GraphQL/REST APIs. Ideal for building digital experiences with structured data while giving editors full control.

name: Payload CMS
description: Payload is a headless CMS and application framework built with Node.js and React. It offers a full admin interface, custom content types, file storage, authentication, and GraphQL/REST APIs. Payload is developer-first, with full TypeScript support, and can be extended like a traditional Express app.

name: Strapi
description: Strapi is a leading open-source headless CMS that enables developers to build APIs quickly while offering a rich admin interface for managing content. It supports customizable roles, media libraries, GraphQL/REST APIs, and plugin extensions. Strapi is built with Node.js and is widely used for building content-driven applications.

name: Sanity
description: Sanity is a real-time headless CMS and content platform that separates content management from content presentation. It features a customizable editor studio, structured content modeling, live collaboration, and APIs for delivery via GraphQL or GROQ. Sanity is ideal for teams that need flexible, developer-friendly content pipelines.

name: KeystoneJS
description: KeystoneJS is an open-source headless CMS and GraphQL API framework for Node.js applications. It supports custom schemas, access control, authentication, and file/image storage. Keystone is used to build highly tailored content and admin platforms with full extensibility and a focus on developer experience.

name: Umami
description: Umami is a simple, privacy-focused, open-source web analytics platform. It tracks page views, events, and referral sources without using cookies or personal data. The lightweight dashboard supports custom domains, real-time reporting, and GDPR compliance, making it ideal for self-hosted analytics.

name: Plausible Analytics
description: Plausible is a lightweight, open-source alternative to Google Analytics focused on simplicity and privacy. It requires no cookies, complies with GDPR/CCPA/PECR, and has a clean interface with real-time traffic reporting. Plausible is ideal for developers and businesses seeking ethical, self-hosted analytics solutions.

name: Ackee
description: Ackee is a self-hosted, Node.js-based analytics platform that provides simple traffic insights while respecting user privacy. It uses MongoDB for storage, tracks unique visits, referrers, and durations, and avoids cookies. Ackee is ideal for developers who need lightweight, GDPR-compliant analytics.

name: GoatCounter
description: GoatCounter is a lightweight web analytics platform written in Go. It supports self-hosted and SaaS modes, tracks visitors without cookies, and has a minimalist UI. Designed for ethical analytics, GoatCounter is suitable for privacy-conscious websites and developers preferring Go-based stacks.

name: Counter.dev
description: Counter.dev is a privacy-respecting analytics service designed for developers. It provides clean dashboards, live statistics, and essential metrics like bounce rate, referrers, and country. Counter.dev uses no cookies or tracking pixels, ensuring GDPR compliance by default.

name: Matomo
description: Matomo is an open-source web analytics platform that offers full data ownership and advanced features like heatmaps, A/B testing, tag management, and ecommerce tracking. It can be self-hosted or used in the cloud, with a strong focus on compliance and privacy. A powerful alternative to Google Analytics.

name: Shynet
description: Shynet is a modern, self-hosted analytics tool that respects user privacy and avoids cookies. It provides interactive dashboards, uptime checks, real-time data, and customizable event tracking. Shynet is ideal for developers and startups who want full control over analytics without third-party tracking.

name: Offen Fair Analytics
description: Offen is an open-source analytics platform built around user consent and transparency. It allows users to view the data collected about them and opt-out at any time. Offen runs in a self-hosted environment and is designed for organizations that prioritize ethical data practices and privacy compliance.

name: Google Analytics Data API
description: Google Analytics Data API (GA4) provides access to your Google Analytics reporting data via a secure REST API. It supports custom dimensions, filters, cohort analysis, and multi-channel attribution. Ideal for integrating analytics into custom dashboards or backend systems, the API replaces the previous Universal Analytics APIs for GA4 properties.

name: Snowplow
description: Snowplow is a behavioral data platform that enables organizations to capture rich, structured event data across web, mobile, and server-side apps. It supports real-time pipelines, schema validation, and destination integrations like Redshift, BigQuery, and Snowflake. Ideal for custom analytics stacks and data warehousing.

name: RudderStack
description: RudderStack is an open-source Customer Data Platform (CDP) that collects, transforms, and routes event data from your applications to data warehouses, analytics tools, and marketing systems. Built with privacy and scalability in mind, it supports JavaScript, iOS, Android, and server-side SDKs.

name: PostHog
description: PostHog is an open-source product analytics suite with features like session replay, heatmaps, A/B testing, and event tracking. It offers self-hosting, full data ownership, and integrates with modern tech stacks via SDKs. PostHog is designed for product teams that want full-stack observability and analytics without third-party SaaS dependencies.

name: Highlight
description: Highlight is an open-source fullstack monitoring platform offering session replay, logs, and error tracking. It integrates with frontend frameworks like React and backend runtimes like Node.js, Go, and Python. Highlight allows developers to debug issues visually and understand user flows in real-time.

name: OpenObserve
description: OpenObserve is an open-source observability platform that supports log analytics, traces, and metrics under one unified interface. It offers high ingestion speed, low storage cost, and support for OpenTelemetry. OpenObserve is designed to be a drop-in replacement for ELK or Grafana Loki with better performance.

name: HyperDX
description: HyperDX is an open-source observability platform that combines logs, traces, and metrics in a single developer-friendly interface. It features powerful search, real-time ingestion, and a focus on modern cloud-native workflows. HyperDX integrates with OpenTelemetry and Kubernetes, and is ideal for debugging and incident response.

name: Logto
description: Logto is an open-source identity and access management (IAM) platform that supports OAuth2, OpenID Connect, and passwordless login. Designed for developers building modern apps, it includes admin dashboards, SDKs for major frameworks, and integrations with GitHub, Google, and Microsoft for SSO.

name: Descope
description: Descope is a developer-first authentication and user management platform offering passwordless login, MFA, RBAC, and session management. It provides SDKs and widgets for integrating auth workflows quickly into web and mobile apps, and supports email, OTP, magic links, social logins, and WebAuthn.

name: ORY Hydra
description: ORY Hydra is an OAuth2 and OpenID Connect server optimized for secure and scalable identity federation. It provides enterprise-ready features like consent flows, JWT support, and dynamic client registration. Hydra is often used with other ORY tools (like Kratos and Keto) to implement secure access control in modern applications.
